intro: Steironema lanceolatum var. hybridum, commonly known as the hybrid lanceleaf steironema, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenia plants. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for horticultural use in tropical and subtropical regions.
